page.title: 04HOARWITHY CHURCH
page.content: The Italian style church at Hoarwithy provides an unusual feature in this typical Herefordshire scene.The original Chapel of Ease was erected in the 1840s,but when the Rev.william Poole became vicar he decided to enhence the plain building.By 1888 the unique church with its cloisters and camponile tower,designed by a London archetect,has been built around the existing chapel.The ornate interior is decorated with mosaics,marble columns,wood carvings and stained glass windows.The church built of red sandstone has not weathered well,and the mosaics are in need of repair.Restoration of ST. Catherine's commenced in 1971 with further work completed in 1980.Services are held monthly,attanded by a small but enthusiastic congregation.
